page.title: 17Craigie School's Century
page.content: Our school opened in{1884}and last year celebrated its{centenary}with many events. The{Victorian era}was strongly featured with one classroom, teacher and pupils, as it might have been in 1884. Our art room became a Victorian parlour with many{exhibits {made}by the{children themselves. The gym./assembly hall was laid out with school{memorabilia_}photographs, Log Books, trophies etc. Some of the most interesting exhibits came from {past pupils}in the form of snapshots, Report Cards, needlework samplers and letters. At a{dinner}former members of staff joined with the present to reminisce. {More}than a{thousand}nostalgic{former {pupils,}many of whom had travelled {long distances,}attended an{Open Day and happily{renewed friendships}begun, in at least one case,{fifty years ago.
